critique: This document is an executive order transferring the Sample Surveys Section of the Work Projects Administration to the Bureau of the Census. It was issued during World War II under the First War Powers Act. Given the context of wartime, the transfer of resources suggests a move towards centralizing data collection and analysis, likely for war-related efforts. There is no mention of immigration, civil liberties, or social issues. The order itself doesn't inherently expand executive power beyond what was already granted by the War Powers Act. The economic impact is minimal and indirect. The transfer of functions suggests a slight move towards federal control.
